des:
The Revel app from Pearson lets you read, practice, and study — anywhere and anytime.

And the free Revel skill for Amazon Alexa gives you another option to learn and review on your terms. It makes it easy to check your assignment due dates, and even listen to your text via the audio playlist feature (available for most titles) on your Amazon Echo or other Alexa-enabled devices.

Using Alexa is as simple as asking a question. Want to make sure you stay on top of your homework?
Ask, “Alexa, when is my next assignment due in Pearson Revel?” Want to listen to a chapter? Simply say, “Alexa, play Chapter 4 in Pearson Revel.” The Revel app tracks your progress across all your devices, including your Alexa-enabled devices, so you can always continue listening where you left off.

The Revel app and the Revel skill for Amazon Alexa are both designed for use only with Revel titles from Pearson. Revel access is title-specific and edition-specific and is not transferable. Before purchasing, check with your instructor to confirm the correct ISBN for your Revel title. In addition to a Revel access code, you will need a course invite link, provided by your instructor, to register for and use Revel.

Need help? Search for Alexa articles on https://support.pearson.com/getsupport
Frequently asked questions guide: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/article/Revel-Skill-for-Amazon-Alexa-FAQs

Contact Us about anything at https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/contactsupport

Examples of supported phrases:
"Alexa, play chapter 3 from Pearson Revel"
"Alexa, play section 3 point 2 point 1 from Pearson Revel" (refers to a section titled 3.2.1)
"Alexa, continue where I left off in Pearson Revel"
"Alexa, when is my next assignment due in Pearson Revel"
"Alexa, play my assignment due tomorrow in Pearson Revel"
"Alexa, play my assignment due on September 10th in Pearson Revel" (tip - say the year if Alexa is having trouble understanding you)
"Alexa, start my next assignment in Pearson Revel"
"Alexa, list my upcoming assignments in Pearson Revel"
